medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient had a history of biliary colic. The symptoms began with an episode of biliary colic in the past; recently, she experienced increasing crampy right upper quadrant and epigastric pain radiating to the back after a meal last night. She reported feeling weak and has had two previous discharges with ongoing pain. Denies fevers or chills.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Thyroid cancer s/p thyroidectomy, prior SBOs managed conservatively, hypertension, GERD, osteoporosis, H. pylori, anxiety, dementia, nephrolithiasis, gallstones, hematuria, incidentally noticed side branch IPMN, benign right hepatic duct stricture. Previous surgeries include total thyroidectomy and total hysterectomy.
medical_history.social_history: Social situation still insecure but patient agreed to have surgery at this time.
